title: Gaza: New accounts of the 'flour massacre'
summary: On February 29, 118 Palestinians were killed and 760 injured while waiting for a humanitarian aid convoy, according to the local Ministry of Health. Survivors tell Le Monde they were the target of Israeli fire.

title: Macron's allies blast far right at European election campaign launch
summary: 'They have always said no to Europe,' said Prime Minister Gabriel Attal, at a campaign event in Lille.

title: Netanyahu 'hurting Israel more than helping,' according to Biden
summary: In a TV interview on Saturday, the American President pointed out an Israeli ground attack on Rafah "is a red line (...) but I'm never going to leave Israel."

title: The DMA comes into force in the EU, with Apple already strongly contested
summary: Digital industry players are already denouncing the lack of compliance with the European regulation, which came into effect on March 7 and aims to subject industry giants to competition rules.

title: MMA's Benoît Saint Denis: Former para in the octagon on Saturdays, churchgoer on Sundays
summary: The French fighter is taking on the American Dustin Poirier, one of the stars of MMA, in Miami, Florida. Success would give him a chance to fight for the lightweight belt.

title: Six Nations: England ends Ireland's Grand Slam bid with late drop goal
summary: Marcus Smith's last-ditch drop-goal clinched a 23-22 win for England.

title: Lebanon: Israeli airstrike kills five people, including three Hezbollah members
summary: Since the start of the Israel-Hamas war in October at least 312 people, mainly Hezbollah fighters, and 56 civilians have been killed in Lebanon. The fighting is mainly along border regions but fears have grown of a broader conflict in Lebanon.

title: Leader of Marseille's 'Yoda' drug gang arrested in Morocco
summary: Félix Bingui, the leader one of the two main gangs in the southern French city, was arrested in Casablanca, French authorities said.

title: Irish constitutional referendum on family and women's roles defeated, concedes PM
summary: Taoiseach Leo Varadkar said the two proposals to modernize language in the 1937 Constitution about the definition of family and a mother's 'duties in the home.'

title: 'The Regime': Kate Winslet plays paranoid autocrat in dystopia created by 'Succession' alumnus
summary: In Will Tracy's bold but overly complex political fiction, the brilliant British actress takes on the role of a neurotic, unpopular chancellor.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Government to pay civil servants bonuses to avoid strikes
summary: Public Administration Minister Stanislas Guerini said eligible workers will get a bonus ranging from €500 to €1,500, two days after a major union said it would file strike notices covering the duration of the Games.

title: UK's David Cameron opposes sending troops to Ukraine, even for training
summary: Cameron said training missions are best carried out abroad, as British troops have done so far.

title: Six Nations: Italy celebrates rare win after stunning Scotland
summary: Italy won its first Six Nations hole match in 11 years, offering Ireland the chance to claim the title later on Saturday.

title: Expanding Israeli settlements a 'war crime', according to the UN
summary: France's foreign ministry also said it 'strongly condemns' the settlement plan and called on the Israeli government to 'immediately reverse this decision' to build another 3,476 settler homes in the West Bank colonies.

title: The best places to stay, eat, drink and see in Nice
summary: To visit the city on the French Riviera without getting lost or stumbling into tourist traps, Le Monde journalists selected 20 top addresses.

title: In Mexico, Carlos Slim shows press he's still got it
summary: The Mexican tycoon spoke to journalists in Mexico City for the first time in five years. The billionaire fought back against the accusations made by Oxfam.

title: After Istanbul visit, Zelensky is counting on Turkey's support
summary: On March 8, the Ukrainian president met with his Turkish counterpart, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who is once again trying to mediate between Kyiv and Moscow.

title: European elections: Macron's coalition looks to frame race as duel with far right
summary: Emmanuel Macron's Renaissance party and its allies are holding a rally in Lille to launch their campaign, which will be led by MEP Valérie Hayer. They are focusing their attacks Marine Le Pen's eurosceptic Rassemblement National party.

title: Crisis in Haiti prompts thousands to flee to Dominican Republic
summary: Gang violence in Port-au-Prince has led to the internal displacement of 200,000 people in 2023 and 15,000 people in just the last week of February.

title: Nigeria: Fifteen students kidnapped by armed men
summary: Three days after the abduction of 280 children, around fifteen students from an Islamic school, aged 8 to 14, were kidnapped in the early hours of Saturday morning.

title: Ilker Çatak, director of 'The Teachers' Lounge': 'You only hear about immigrants when there's a disaster'
summary: In an interview with 'Le Monde,' the filmmaker explains how he drew inspiration from a childhood memory in a German school.

title: Portugal's far right on the rise as country votes in legislative elections
summary: The Chega party is projected to receive 16% to 18% of the vote in Sunday's race, organized after the revelation of corruption scandals involving close associates of Socialist Prime Minister Antonio Costa.

title: Six Nations: Emmanuel Meafou, the colossus who wants to 'give back to France' what it 'has given' him
summary: The second row will make his international debut with Les Bleus against Wales on Sunday. An achievement for the Australian-born player who arrived in Toulouse at the end of 2018 – and can't imagine leaving the country any time soon.

title: French health professionals sound the alarm on young people's growing suicidal ideation
summary: Suicidal ideation and suicide attempts are on the rise among 18-24 year-olds, while they are stagnating in other age groups. Anxiety from climate change, war, and lacking opportunities weigh heavily on young people's minds.

title: NATO holds biggest military exercises in Europe since end of Cold War
summary: Dubbed Steadfast Defender 24, the alliance's large-scale maneuver involves some 90,000 troops from 32 countries and no fewer than 1,100 armored vehicles.

title: European elections: Macron's pick Hayer and allies kick off campaign
summary: President Emmanuel Macron's allies took aim at Russia and the far-right Rassemblement National party for their first campaign event ahead of of the June 9 vote.

title: No more Pushkin, Dostoyevsky, or Tolstoy: Ukrainian libraries clean out shelves
summary: Russian authors have disappeared from the shelves of most Ukrainian libraries since the 2022 invasion in a decision that the literary-minded staff of these libraries are not taking lightly, but rather out of a sense of patriotism. At the same time, these establishments are striving to meet a growing fever for Ukrainian books.

title: At a rural French casino, swapping boredom for dreams of the jackpot: 'We can't travel anymore, so we splurge!'
summary: Far from the stereotypes portrayed by the chicest among them, the 202 French gaming establishments are places of social and generational diversity. In one casino in eastern France, a varied clientele comes to try their luck as much as to break their solitude.

title: Six Nations: Facing Wales, France gives a chance to new faces
summary: Two weeks after a draw with Italy and after a poor start to the tournament, Les Bleus travel to Cardiff on Sunday hoping to change the momentum.

title: Maia Sandu, president of Moldova: 'There is nothing more important than helping Ukraine win this war'
summary: The leader of this country of 2.6 million inhabitants bordering Ukraine believes that its European integration is a question of 'survival.'

title: Denmark establishes itself as one of Europe's biggest donors to Ukraine
summary: Since the start of the Russian invasion, the Scandinavian kingdom has announced arms deliveries worth €4.5 billion. The country's commitment is based on unwavering consensus.

title: Seven missing after floods snare cars in southern France
summary: French rescue workers were searching for seven people, including two children, after storms in the south of the country.

title: Dominique Méda: 'Fear is back in Europe'
summary: In her column, the sociologist recalls the European project of The Hague Congress in 1948, when the aim was to build a federal Europe against war and national egoism.

title: American cyclist Matteo Jorgenson wins Paris-Nice race
summary: Team Visma-Lease a Bike's rider became the third American to win the eight-stage race.

title: Ligue 1: PSG draws again as Mbappé is left on the bench once more
summary: Paris Saint-Germain drew 2-2 at home to Stade de Reims. Kylian Mbappé was only brought on at the 73rd minute.
